clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Inflammation of the Anterior Segment by Laser Flashmeter in Patients Having Undergone Surgery of the Posterior Segment (Vitrectomy or Preindentation) During the First Postoperative Year. (FLAVIC)
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Inflammation of the Anterior Segment by Laser Flashmeter in Patients Having Undergone Surgery of the Posterior Segment (Vitrectomy or Preindentation) During the First Postoperative Year. (FLAVIC)

brief_summary.textblock: Observational study, monocentric, prospective, descriptive and comparative (eye operated vs fellow eye).

detailed_description.textblock:
After surgery by vitrectomy or preindentation, an anti-inflammatory treatment is conventionally prescribed for a duration of 1 month. However, frequently, during the post-operative control at one month, there may be signs of ocular inflammation or symptoms of discomfort justifying the prolongation of post-operative treatment. A 2012 study evaluated post-operative flare follow-up in 22 vitrectomized patients for retinal detachment, and showed a significantly higher flare 3 months after surgery, compared to the other eye and pre-surgery value.
In this study, the investigators wish to study postoperative inflammation in patients operated for posterior segment ocular surgery (vitrectomy or preindentation) measured by laser flashmeter on a follow-up of one year.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Changes between baseline (preoperatively) and day 7, month 1, month 2, month 3, month 6, and month 12 measures
primary_outcome.description: Evolution of the flare value preoperatively and then to D7, M1, M2, M3, M6, M12 of the operated eye

secondary_outcome.measure: Flare values of the fellow eye and the operated eye
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Difference between flare values of the fellow eye and the operated eye at each evaluation time : baseline (preoperatively), day 7, month 1, month 2, month 3, month 6, and month 12
secondary_outcome.description: Flare value of the fellow eye and the operated eye at each evaluation time

other_outcome.measure: Flare value of the operated eye
other_outcome.time_frame: Changes between baseline (preoperatively) and day 7, month 1, month 2, month 3, month 6, and month 12 measures
other_outcome.description: Flare value of the operated eye preoperatively and at each evaluation time
Identification of criteria associated with high inflammation : indication of surgery
Identification of criteria associated with high inflammation : ophthalmologic antecedents
Identification of criteria associated with high inflammation : high preoperative IOP
Identification of criteria associated with high inflammation : BCVA (better visual acuity corrected) preoperatively

intervention.description: Measurement of the inflammation of the operated eye and the fellow eye before the surgery and at each post-surgery visit: D7, M1, M2, M3, M6, M12

study_pop.textblock: Major patient undergoing vitrectomy or preindentation in the ophthalmology department of Rennes University Hospital

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Major patient,
- Operation of vitrectomy or preindentation in the ophthalmology department of Rennes University Hospital for one of the following reasons:
- Retinal detachment, rhegmatogenous or not
- Combined surgery
- Membrane peeling
- Macular hole
- Optically targeted vitrectomy (Terson's syndrome, intravitreous haemorrhage)
- Covered by a health insurance system,
- Having received information on the protocol and not having expressed opposition to participating in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Vitrectomy for endophthalmitis or posterior uveitis,
- Patient with vitreoretinal proliferation (grade B and C),
- Pregnant or nursing woman,
- Major patient subject to legal protection (safeguard of justice, guardianship, guardianship), person deprived of liberty.
